There is no dosage adjustments available for chloroquine in patients with renal failure from the manufacture's labeling but according to UpToDate some clinicians use the following guideline 52:
A)
Patients with GFR â‰¥ 10 ml/min: No dosage adjustment is required.
B)
Patients with GFR < 10 ml/min: Dosage should be reduced to 50%.
C)
Patients with peritoneal- or hemodialysis: Dosage should be reduced to 50%.
D)
Patients with continuous renal replacement therapy (CRRT): No dosage adjustment is required.
